dmca.title: [ThePlanetAbuse-C3699843P] abuse
dmca.body:
To Whom It May Concern:

Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
substantially comply with the required notification elements of the
Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").

Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your
claim.

Please visit our web site at
www.theplanet.com/about_us/legal_docs/ThePlanet%20Copyright%20Infringeme
nt%2001%2015%2007%20FINAL.pdf
 
Legal Response Team
THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.

-----Original Message-----
From: abuse@theplanet.com [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com] 
Sent: Friday, March 30, 2007 10:59 PM
To: DMCA
Subject: [ThePlanetAbuse-C3699843P] abuse

==== Forwarded Ticket ====

MIME element (text/plain) 
To whom it may concern 
 
The following IP belongs to on of your servers or is within your IP
block. 
Please notify the correct hosts of this fraudulent IP immediately: 
 
207.44.162.90 
 
Please understand that after receiving this message, you have been 
notified of individual(s) conducting illegal activities using your 
servers. If you fail to take down this website and all associated email 
addresses, you could be held liable for any damages incurred. 
 
THE SITES ON THIS IP ARE FRAUDULENT FOR THE FOLLOWING REASONS: 
 
- Brand abuse: many websites bear the names of protected brands in the 
title/domain name. For example: top2nike.com, yahoo-nike.com, 
jordansell.com, etc. 
Another example: Many sites (for example: http://www.eyeb2b.com/)
pretend 
to sell Lacoste products even though Lacoste declared publicly that
their 
products are not being distributed over the internet (can be verified
via 
www.lacoste.com). 
 
This is a clear breach of brand/copyright law, which is a violation of 
your AUP. I've also reported this to the responsible companies legal
team. 
 
 
- No or incomplete physical addresses are given for most sites. How
should 
a customer visit these companies or reach it physically? How should a 
customer verify it as real? This is an attempt to avoid being checked 
against being legitimate. 
For example: http://wentbuy.com/contact.asp 
 
- use of free email accounts such as intonike@hotmail.com or 
cartsong@hotmail.com (taken from http://intonike.com/contact.asp ) A 
        reputable company would not do this. 
 
- Short registration: all websites have been registered registered 
recently /and/or for just one year, to avoid losses in case the site
gets 
shut down. For example: 
 
BEST-SPORTSHOES.COM 
Updated Date: 17-sep-2006 
Creation Date: 21-apr-2006 
Expiration Date: 21-apr-2007 
 
 
+ The domain registration information is recent, though the sites claim
to 
have been in business for some time. The site http://shoesgoogle.com/
for 
example claims to have been in business since 2000. The WHOIS
registration 
says: "Created 01-mar-2006" 
 
+ Sites gather personal information on insecure form. Legitimate 
businesses do not gather this type of information without security 
precautions. 
http://mart-top.com/ (member login) 
 
 
 
Here's a list with all fraudulent domains on this IP: 
 
0086shoes.com 
2007nike.com 
2008goodshoes.com

PLEASE TAKE THE FOLLOWING ACTION RIGHT AWAY: 
 
    * Verify the fraudulent nature of this IP/these websites, as
outlined 
above. 
 
    * Shut down all email accounts and web pages associated with this 
site, and hold a copy for the authorities. 
 
    * Redirect all traffic for these domains to the following page, to 
inform potential visitors of the dangers of internet fraud: 
 
http://www.met.police.uk/fraudalert/ 
 
    * Check for other sites/domains established by this customer: fake 
sites tend to be created by a small number of people. 
 
    * Contact the police with any credit card and contact information
you 
have on record: fraudulent sites are often funded with stolen credit 
cards. 
 
REMEMBER: THE PEOPLE BEHIND THESE SITES ARE CRIMINALS, OFTEN MEMBERS OF 
INTERNATIONAL GANGS. DO NOT REVEAL PERSONAL INFORMATION TO THEM EXCEPT 
WHEN ABSOLUTELY NECESSARY. 
 
I am also forwarding this information to cp@interpol.int for their 
investigative purposes. http://www.met.police.uk/fraudalert/ 
 
Help us stamp out scams. Shut down these websites! 
 
 
Thank you for your prompt attention. If you feel more information is 
needed before you can proceed with closing this domain, please feel free

to contact me at: robert_steinmann@aa419.org 
 
Sincerely, 
 
R.Steinmann 
 
--  
Robert Steinmann 
Artists Against 419 
www.aa419.org
